titles.title: Dǝrsanä Maryam, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Mary

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Dǝrsanä Maryam, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Mary (fols. 1ra-148rb), incomplete, fols. misplaced I-1) Mäṣḥafä lǝdäta lä-Maryam “Book of the Nativity of Mary”, for the 1st Gǝnbot (fols. 1rv, 2r-7v) (Cp. M. CHAINE, Apocrypha de Beata Maria Virgine, Romae 1909 [CSCO 39, 40 (Sae 22, 23)], “Liber nativitatis Mariae”), incomplete I-2) Homily on St. Mary, how she was born, how she was introduced into the temple, how she was committed to Joseph and how she went to Zacharias´ house, for the 3rd Taḫśaś (fols. 8ra-19va), beginning missing, but fol. 7 of Ms UM-043 belongs to the same text (cp. Orient. 604, no. 3) I-3) Homily on the Annunciation of Gabriel to Mary, for the 29th Mäggabit (fols. 19vb-27vb), end missing (cp. Orient. 604, no. 8) I-4) Unidentified hymn to St. Mary (28ra-39va), incomplete I-5) Homily by Theophilos of Alexandria on the House in which the Holy Virgin lived on Mount Qusqam (fols. 39vb-40vb, 42rv, 41rv, 44ra-83rb) (Cp. C. CONTI ROSSINI, Il discorso su Monte Coscam attribuito a Teofilo d’Alessandria nella versione etiopica, Roma 1912 [RRALm ser. 5a, 21, 395-471]), I-6) Unidentified text (a hymn to the Lord?) (fol. 43rv) I-7) Mäṣḥafä fǝlsäta lä-Maryam “Book of the Assumption of Mary” (fols. 83va-121vb) (Cp. M. CHAINE, Apocrypha de Beata Maria Virgine, Romae 1909 [CSCO 39, 40 (Sae 22, 23)], “Liber transmigrationis Mariae”), incomplete (one fol. is missing between fols. 89 and 90, one between fols. 90 and 91) I-8) Homily on the discovery of the history of Mary (fols. 122ra-126vb, 130rv, 127ra-129vb) (cp. Orient. 604, no. 5) I-9) Täzkarä sämaʿt ʾǝllä bä-Rom dǝḫnu bä-ʾaminä Krǝstos by Jacob of Sarugh, a text concerning a certain Yaʿqob Romawi, for the 21st Ṭǝrr (fols. 131ra-142vb, 144ra-148vb), incomplete I-10) Unidentified text on the journey of Mary in the Gehenna (fols. 143rv), different from the Apocalypse of Mary.

donors.donor: Maḥḍäntä Krǝstos is mentioned in the supplication formulas on fols. 39rb, 89vb, 109vb.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is slightly damaged by water and by rodents. The boards are missing. The sewing is severely damaged and has been repaired with modern threads. Many leaves are stained with water, especially at the beginning and the end of the Ms., e.g. fols. 1, 2, 40, 58, 62, 64. Text on fols. 1ra-b, 1va-b, 2ra-b, 148va-b and some letters on fol. 61vb, 62ra, 64ra, 65vb, 67ra are illegible or barely legible due to humidity. Many fols. are misplaced and some are missing.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both missing), Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and to the tail of the codex.

txfolios.txfolio: Foliation mistake: fol. 123a has not been numbered.

squires.squire: The structure of quire is not discernible due to present condition of the Ms.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written below the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Some distinctive features: - the handwriting is conspicuously right-sloping, - ሎ has the loop marking the 7th order sometimes attached directly to the body of the letter, without the linking line (e.g., fols. 10vb l. 2, 18va l. 1) - መ has the loops not completely separated, of triangular shape (e.g. 138rb l. 11) - the numerals are written without dashes (e.g. fols. 13va-b, 53va, 116ra-vb, 138ra-b, 146rb) - ው has the stroke marking the 6th order on the top of the body of the letter (e.g. fols. 11rb l. 5 and 11, 99ra l. 13, 120vb l. 9) - ፮ looks like “compressed” ፯ (e.g. fols. 78va, 116vb) - ፴ has a very short left stroke (fol. 137ra) - ፪ has angular and not separated loops (fol. 15vb).

pcruxansatas.pcruxansata: the crux ansata and the coronis together are used in the margins of some texts, marking the beginning (fols. 1ra, 19vb etc.)

rubrications.rubrication:
Texts I-5 and I-7 conclude with subscriptiones (fols. 83ra-b, 121vb). Sentence dividers are accompanied by paragraph signs throughout the whole Ms.
Texts I-1, I-2, I-3, I-5, I-7, I-8 have been published in S. BOMBECK, Die Geschichte der heiligen Maria in einer alten Äthiopischen Handschrift: Einleitung, kritischer Apparat, Übersetzung, Anmerkungen, Kommentar, Dortmund 2010.

extras.extra: - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally probably in the main hand: e.g., fols. 2ra, 20vb, 40rb, 52ra, 120vb, 128rb, 140rb. - Omitted word added at the end of the line: fol. 135ra. - Erasures: fols. 8rb, 14ra, 141vb. - Corrections written over erasures: e.g., fols. 3ra, 15ra-b, 19ra-b, 68vb, 106rb, 115vb. - Scribbles: fols. 1r, 1v, 83rb, 90v, 104v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Daily readings of Texts I-1 and I-5 are indicated by the names of the days written in the upper margin: አም፩፡ ለግንቦት።: fol. 1ra erased: fol. 39vb.
